prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I have lvy and diastolic dysfunction how to correct the condition

PATIENT: hello doctor I have been taking steroids on and off for the past three years I got martial fibrillation a year ago never again since then my blood pressure was quite high 152 90 at the doctor la is normal and lvedd is 53 my normal systolic function no regional wall movement abnormalities lvy 14 my and beginning diastolic dysfunction a e 15 la 21 am I already lost 24 keg and now I am weighing 10 keg at 194 am my goal is 93 keg I also stopped steroids and now my blood pressure is 123 75 will my diastolic function recover once I managed to reverse the lvy

DOCTOR: hello I have gone through your query can I know why were you on steroids was there any particular disease that was diagnosed and started you with steroids as there are many determinants causing diastolic dysfunction one of the common cause is hypertension and yes diastolic dysfunction is reversible in the majority of the cases over a period of time if you properly control your be obesity and start doing regular exercise consume a healthy diet and lifestyle modification you should also stop any addictions like smoking or alcohol if any also get your blood sugar levels and thyearoid profile checked get back with details about your disease and indication for steroids for further discussion and management

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: is it true that baldness is hereditary

PATIENT: hi doctor I am 20 years old my hair is getting thin as my father is bald I fear that I will also get bald also I want to improve my skin texture please help

DOCTOR: hi for further information consult an ayurveda specialist online

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I often get bad breath with swollen and bleeding gums how to eradicate this

PATIENT: hello doctor I am facing a bad breath problem sometimes gums get swelled and bleeding happens I do not feel comfortable speaking to someone because of the bad breath issue what can I do to eradicate this problem

DOCTOR: hello I understand your concern gum bleeding gum swelling and bad breath are the signs of gum condition called gingivitis is the inflammation of the gums caused due to constant irritation by tar or calculus hardened yellow deposits on the tooth food deposits or plaque that settles on the tooth get calcified in the long run and become hardened calculus deposits constantly irritated gums become weak and start to bleed when we brush or in the morning time after waking up a professional scaling and polishing procedure is done by an ultrasonic scale instrument to remove that calculus once removed the gums take a day to heal and the gum bleeding and gum swelling will resolve the next morning you will also see an improvement in your bad breath issue please visit your dentist and get this procedure done this procedure can be done once in six months if required although we do a proper brushing every day there are certain spots between teeth where the bristles fail to reach hence a professional tooth cleaning is always advised once in a while there are certain brushing techniques that can be followed to prevent calculus accumulation get to know that from your dentist and please do follow them and you should start cleaning the tongue with a tongue cleaner or by using the back of the brush this will be effective in reducing the bad breath issue I hope this helps

STATUS: low severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: persistent dizziness when standing up quickly

PATIENT: hello doctor I am a 35 year old female and for the past few months I feel dizzy and lightheaded whenever I stand up quickly from sitting or lying position sometimes I see black spots before my eyes and feel like I might faint this lasts for about 10-15 seconds then gradually improves my blood pressure readings are normal when checked at rest 120 80 but I haven't measured it immediately after standing I don't have any heart conditions that I know of but I have been feeling more tired than usual lately should I be concerned about this

DOCTOR: hello thank you for describing your symptoms what you're experiencing sounds like orthostatic hypotension which is a form of low blood pressure that occurs when standing up from sitting or lying down this happens because blood temporarily pools in your legs reducing blood flow to your brain this condition can be caused by dehydration anemia certain medications or underlying neurological issues I would recommend you try rising slowly from seated or lying positions and ensure you're drinking enough fluids throughout the day also try flexing your leg muscles before standing to help pump blood back to your heart it would be helpful to check your blood pressure in lying sitting and standing positions to confirm the diagnosis if symptoms persist I suggest consulting your physician for further evaluation including complete blood count to rule out anemia and electrolyte tests to check for dehydration in some cases a tilt table test might be recommended to assess your body's blood pressure regulation

STATUS: low severity
